   Implementation:

        We'll create a hash set for integers. We'll use a fixed HASH_SIZE (say 100003, a prime).

        We'll write:

            #define HASH_SIZE 100003

            typedef struct Node {
                int key;
                struct Node* next;
            } Node;

            Node* hashTable[HASH_SIZE] = {NULL};

        Then:

            int contains(int key) {
                int index = abs(key) % HASH_SIZE;
                Node* p = hashTable[index];
                while (p) {
                    if (p->key == key) return 1;
                    p = p->next;
                }
                return 0;
            }

            void insert(int key) {
                if (contains(key)) return;
                int index = abs(key) % HASH_SIZE;
                Node* newNode = (Node*)malloc(sizeof(Node));
                newNode->key = key;
                newNode->next = hashTable[index];
                hashTable[index] = newNode;
            }

        int compare_ints(const void* a, const void* b) {
            return (*(int*)a - *(int*)b);
        }

        int compare_longs(const void* a, const void* b) {
            long long aa = *(long long*)a;
            long long bb = *(long long*)b;
            if (aa < bb) return -1;
            if (aa > bb) return 1;
            return 0;
        }

   For the hash set: we use chaining.

   We'll define:

        #define HASH_SIZE 100003

        typedef struct Node {
            int key;
            struct Node* next;
        } Node;

        Node* hashTable[HASH_SIZE] = {NULL};

        int contains(int key) {
            int index = abs(key) % HASH_SIZE;
            Node* p = hashTable[index];
            while (p) {
                if (p->key == key) return 1;
                p = p->next;
            }
            return 0;
        }

        void insert(int key) {
            if (contains(key)) return;
            int index = abs(key) % HASH_SIZE;
            Node* newNode = (Node*)malloc(sizeof(Node));
            newNode->key = key;
            newNode->next = hashTable[index];
            hashTable[index] = newNode;
        }

        #define MAX_ARR 100000
        #define MAX_LINE 1000000
        #define LIMIT 10000000000LL

        long long lucky_numbers[1000];
        int lucky_count = 0;

        void gen(long long num, int four, int seven) {
            if (num > LIMIT) return;
            if (num > 0 && four == seven) {
                lucky_numbers[lucky_count++] = num;
            }
            gen(num*10+4, four+1, seven);
            gen(num*10+7, four, seven+1);
        }

            // Parse the array line
            int arr[MAX_ARR];
